questions.question: What are the synthesis conditions for 2,3‘-Dicyanodiphenylacetylene (2,3‘-DCPA, 1)?
questions.answer: 2,3‘-Dicyanodiphenylacetylene (2,3‘-DCPA, 1) was prepared by a three-step sequence involving palladium-catalyzed cross coupling of (trimethylsilyl)acetylene with 2-bromobenzonitrile to afford trimethylsilyl-protected 2-ethynylbenzonitrile (9) in high yield. Deprotection to the terminal acetylene was performed with K2CO3 in MeOH and CH2Cl2, and the product was not isolated. The formation of 2,3‘-DCPA was achieved in good yield via palladium-catalyzed cross coupling of the terminal acetylene with 3-bromobenzonitrile.

questions.question: What crystal system and space group are reported for the complex [Ag(2,3‘-DCPA)(CF3SO3)]2 (4)?
questions.answer: The complex [Ag(2,3‘-DCPA)(CF3SO3)]2 (4) crystallizes in the triclinic crystal system and belongs to the P-1 space group.

questions.question: How does the substitution pattern of nitrile groups on diphenylacetylene influence the topology of structures formed with silver(I) salts?
questions.answer: The topology of the structures formed with silver(I) salts depends on the substitution pattern of nitrile groups on diphenylacetylene. For 2,3‘-DCPA (1), cyclic dimers are produced, whereas crystallization of 2,2‘-DCPA (2) yields an infinite chain structure, and 2,4‘-DCPA (3) results in an infinite, undulating sheet structure.

questions.question: What is the role of acetone and acetonitrile in the aggregation of 2,3‘-DCPA with silver(I) salts according to electrospray ionization mass spectrometry (ESI-MS) data?
questions.answer: According to electrospray ionization mass spectrometry (ESI-MS) data, acetone allows for significant aggregation of 2,3‘-DCPA with silver(I) salts even at millimolar concentrations, while acetonitrile disrupts this aggregation due to its competitive coordination to silver(I).

questions.question: What is the significance of the cyclic dimer [Ag2(1)2(CF3SO3)]+ observed in ESI-MS for solutions of 2,3‘-DCPA and AgCF3SO3?
questions.answer: The cyclic dimer [Ag2(1)2(CF3SO3)]+ observed in ESI-MS for solutions of 2,3‘-DCPA and AgCF3SO3 is significant because it corresponds to the cyclic dimer motif observed in the solid-state structures of complexes 4−6, minus one counterion. This suggests the formation of similar cyclic dimers in solution.

questions.question: Is the aggregate [Ag2(1)2(CF3SO3)]+ more abundant in acetone or acetonitrile for solutions of 2,3‘-DCPA and AgCF3SO3?
questions.answer: The aggregate [Ag2(1)2(CF3SO3)]+ is more abundant in acetone compared to acetonitrile for solutions of 2,3‘-DCPA and AgCF3SO3, as acetonitrile's competitive coordination to silver(I) limits aggregation.

questions.question: True or False: The crystal structure of [Ag(2,2‘-DCPA)(CF3SO3)] (7) is reported to have an orthorhombic crystal system and belongs to the Pnma space group.
True or False: The presence of chelated aggregates in solution is suggested by ESI-MS data for 2,2‘-DCPA and AgCF3SO3.
True or False: The cyclic dimer topology is maintained in the presence of three different counterions for complexes formed with 2,3‘-DCPA.
True or False: The coordination number of silver(I) is 2 in the presence of hexafluoroantimonate for the cyclic dimer [Ag(2,3‘-DCPA)]2(SbF6)2 (6).
